message.content:
cs.DM, cs.FL, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC

Reasoning: The paper deals with combinatorial and information-theoretic properties of words, specifically scattered factors and spectra. This suggests that the paper may belong to the Discrete Mathematics (cs.DM) or Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper considers the problem of reconstructing words from their spectra, which is a problem in the field of signal processing and could potentially fall under the category of Formal Languages and Automata Theory (cs.FL). The paper also discusses the properties of balanced and unbalanced words, which could be of interest to researchers in the field of Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) or Computational Complexity (cs.CC).
